Type.Name: TreeModelFilter

TypeSignature.Value: public class TreeModelFilter : GLib.Object, Gtk.TreeDragSource, Gtk.TreeModel

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the Gtk# Thread Programming for details.

Docs.summary: An object designed to filter the contents of a column or columns in a for display.
Sets the filter's iterator to point to the row that corresponds to .
Emits for each row in the child model, which causes the filter to re-evaluate whether a row is visible or not.
Docs.remarks: Added in GTK 2.4.

Docs.summary: Converts to a path relative to this filter.
Docs.remarks: points to a path in the child model. The returned path will point to the same row in the filtered model. If isn't a valid path on the child model, then is returned.

Docs.summary: Returns a new iterator that points to the row pointed to by .
This function should almost never be called.

remarks.para: This function clears the filter of any cached iterators that haven't been reffed with . This might be useful if the child model being filtered is static (and doesn't change often) and there has been a lot of unreffed access to nodes. As a side effect of this function, all unreffed iterators will be invalid.

Docs.summary: Converts to a path on the child model of this filter.
Docs.remarks: points to a location in this filter. The returned path will point to the same location in the model not being filtered. If does not point to a location in the child model, is returned.

Docs.summary: Decrements the reference count for the node at .
Gets the data type stored in the column at .

MemberSignature.Value: public void GetValist (Gtk.TreeIter iter, IntPtr var_args);

Docs.summary: Gets the values of child properties for the row pointed to by
Docs.param: a , pointer to the va_list data structure of arguments (FIXME: clarify what va_lists look like)

Docs.summary: Gets the next row to be filtered.
Generates a string representation of the path of .
Docs.remarks: This string is a ':' separated list of numbers. For example, "4:10:0:3" would be an acceptable return value for this string.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IterParent (out Gtk.TreeIter iter, Gtk.TreeIter child);

Docs.summary: Sets to be the parent of .
Docs.remarks: If is at the toplevel, and does not have a parent, then is set to an invalid iterator and is returned. will remain a valid node after this function has been called.

Docs.summary: Emits an event for .

Docs.summary: Emits an event for .
Docs.param: a , points to the inserted row.

Docs.summary: Gets the of .

Docs.summary: Sets to a valid iterator pointing to .

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IterChildren (out Gtk.TreeIter iter, Gtk.TreeIter parent);

Docs.summary: Sets the TreeIter object pointed to by to point to the first child of this tree.
Docs.returns: an object of type , true if the iter has been set to the first child.

Docs.summary: Returns the number of children that has.
Docs.remarks: As a special case, if is , then the number of toplevel nodes is returned.

Docs.summary: Lets the tree ref the node.

remarks.para: This is an optional method for models to implement. To be more specific, models may ignore this call as it exists primarily for performance reasons.

This function is primarily meant as a way for views to let caching models know when nodes are being displayed (and hence, whether or not to cache that node.) For example, a file-system based model would not want to keep the entire file-hierarchy in memory, just the sections that are currently being displayed by every current view.
A model should be expected to be able to get an iter independent of its referenced state.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool GetIterFromString (out Gtk.TreeIter iter, string path_string);

Docs.summary: Gets the at .
Docs.remarks: Otherwise, is left invalid and is returned.

Docs.summary: Returns if has children, otherwise.

Docs.summary: Emits an event for .

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IterNthChild (out Gtk.TreeIter iter, Gtk.TreeIter parent, int n);

Docs.summary: Sets to be the child of the root node, using the given index.
Docs.remarks: In this case, the nth root node is set.

Docs.summary: Gets the first iterator in the tree (the one at the path "0") and returns .
Docs.remarks: Returns if the tree is empty.

MemberSignature.Value: public void GetValue (Gtk.TreeIter iter, int column, ref GLib.Value value);

Docs.summary: Gets the value stored in column of the row pointed to by .

Docs.summary: Emits an event for .
Docs.param: a , points to the changed row
a , points to the changed row
Docs.remarks: This should be called by models after the child state of a node changes.

Docs.summary: Calls a function on each row of a tree.

Docs.param: a , points to the changed row
a , points to the changed row

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void OnRowsReordered (Gtk.TreePath path, Gtk.TreeIter iter, out int new_order);

Docs.summary: Emits the "rows_reordered" signal for this tree model.
Docs.param: a pointing to the tree node whose children have been reordered
a pointing to the tree node whose children have been reordered
a , an array of integers containing the new indices of the children, i.e. the former child n is now at position new_order[n].
Docs.remarks: This should be called by models when their rows have been reordered.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void OnRowChanged (Gtk.TreePath path, Gtk.TreeIter iter);

Docs.summary: Emits the "row_changed" signal for this model.
Docs.remarks: This should be called by models when their rows have been reordered.

Docs.summary: Emits the signal for this model.
Docs.remarks: This should be called by models when their rows have been reordered.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void OnRowInserted (Gtk.TreePath path, Gtk.TreeIter iter);

Docs.summary: Emits the signal for this model.
Docs.remarks: This should be called by models when a row has been inserted.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void OnRowHasChildToggled (Gtk.TreePath path, Gtk.TreeIter iter);

Docs.summary: Emits the signal for this model.
Docs.remarks: This should be called by models when a row's child has been toggled on or off.

Docs.summary: This method asks the source row for the dragged data to delete itself, because that data has been moved elsewhere.
Docs.param: a , the path of the row that was dragged
Docs.remarks: This method returns FALSE if the deletion fails because path no longer exists, or for some other model-specific reason.

Docs.summary: Checks to see whether a given row can be used as a source for a drag-and-drop operation.
Docs.returns: a , TRUE if the row is draggable.
Docs.remarks: If the object does not implement this method, the row is assumed to be draggable.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool DragDataGet (Gtk.TreePath path, Gtk.SelectionData selection_data);

Docs.summary: Asks the to fill in with a representation of the row at . Should robustly handle a path no longer found in the model.
Docs.param: a object to fill with data
Docs.returns: A see cref="T:System.Boolean" />; true if data of the required type was provided.

Basic constructor.
Constructor. For internal use.
Docs.param: a , pointer to the underlying C object.

Docs.summary: Constructor
Docs.param: a , the model this object is to filter
a , the node to use as the model's root node, pass null to use the entire child tree model.

Docs.summary: The of this object.
The virtual root (relative to the child model) for this object.
The column of the model where this filter should look for visibility information.
Gets the this filter is being applied to.
Flag values for this tree model; see for possible values.
The number of columns in the model.
Event that happens when rows in the model change order.
Event that happens when a row in the model is changed.
Event that happens when a row is deleted.
Event that happens when a row is inserted.
Event that happens when a row's child visibility is turned on or off.
Child tree data model.
The function used to determine whether or not a row should be visible

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetModifyFunc (int n_columns, GLib.GType[] types, Gtk.TreeModelFilterModifyFunc func);

Docs.summary: Sets a function to modify the display of the model.
Docs.remarks: With the and parameters, you give an array of column types for this model (which will be exposed to the parent model/view). The modify function, , will get called for each data access; the goal of the modify function is to return the data which should be displayed at the location specified using the parameters of the modify function.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void OnRowsReordered (Gtk.TreePath path, Gtk.TreeIter iter, int[] new_order);

Docs.param: Path to the reordered parent node.
Iter corresponding to the reordered parent node.
An array of the old indices.
Docs.summary: Default handler for the RowsReordered event.
